description:
Repro:
1) Go to Admin dashboard -> Flavors
2) Click Create Flavor
3) Enter an ID for an existing flavor, fill in other fields with valid values
4) Click Create Flavor

Expected:
Error stating that the flavor already exists.

Actual:
No error, dialog stays visible

Note:
When you cancel the dialog you will see the error in the flash
title: create new flavor with existing id silently fails

comments.content:
Repro:
1) Go to Admin dashboard -> Flavors
2) Click Create Flavor
3) Enter an ID for an existing flavor, fill in other fields with valid values
4) Click Create Flavor

Expected:
Error stating that the flavor already exists.

Actual:
No error, dialog stays visible

Note:
When you cancel the dialog you will see the error in the flash
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~tres

comments.content:
Is this trying to create a flavor with an "ID" (e.g. the user-facing ID) of a flavor that is still active in the system, or one that you deleted (nova marks this as "deleted" in the database) and then tried to re-add with the same ID?

The former should raise an error, that latter should not.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gabriel-hurley

comments.content:
There are two bugs here. One is horizon not handling the error from novaclient properly in the modal.

The other is Nova treating "instance type" (e.g. flavor) names and the user-facing "id"s as globally unique: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L3904

That code needs to filter out "deleted=True" so that "replacing" a flavor isn't blocked by the prior existence of that flavor and subsequent deletion. Treat deleted items as deleted.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gabriel-hurley

comments.content:
Just for future stumblers:

I dunno about the horizon thing, but the core issue of nova allowing creation of duplicate instance types has been fixed in upstream.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danms

comments.content: This will be fixed as part of the blueprint edit-flavor-ui in F3.
